description: The PB_ACCT_TX table contains the transactions associated with premium billing accounts.

columns.name: PB_ACT_TX_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the premium billing account transaction.

columns.name: PB_ACT_TX_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Specifies the type of premium billing account transaction (i.e. premium billing, payment, ad hoc adjustment, balance forward, etc.)


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Premium Billing


Payment


Ad Hoc Adjustment


Balance Forward


Overpost


Writeoff


Payment Reversal


Uncommitted Payment

columns.name: PB_ACT_TX_SENSE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Indicates whether the premium billing account transaction is a credit or charge.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Credit


Charge

columns.name: CYCLE_DATE
columns.description: Cycle date for the premium billing account transaction.

columns.name: PERIOD_DATE
columns.description: Indicates the time period for which the account transaction applies

columns.name: POST_DATE
columns.description: Indicates the date the transaction was posted.

columns.name: PB_ACCT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the premium billing account associated with the transaction.

columns.name: CANC_PB_ACT_TX_ID
columns.description: This column is populated if this transaction reverses another transaction. The unique ID listed is that of the transaction that was reversed.

columns.name: NOT_OUTSTND_DATE
columns.description: Specifies the date on which the premium billing account transaction is no longer outstanding.

columns.name: FIRST_AR_DATE
columns.description: Specifies the first date on which payment is received for the transaction.

columns.name: PB_BAT_ID
columns.description: Specifies the unique ID of the premium billing batch that generated the transaction.

columns.name: ADJ_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
Adjustment reason assigned to the account transaction.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: IDX_PB_ACCT_ID
columns.description: Selective account index for the account transaction.

columns.name: OUTSTND_PB_INVC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of invoice on which the transaction is outstanding.

columns.name: CLOSE_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description:
Indicates the reason the transaction has been closed.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Paid In Full


Balance Forward

columns.name: SINCE_PB_ACCT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the premium billing invoice.

columns.name: PB_TXSET_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the transaction set.

columns.name: USEDIN_PB_TXSET_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the transaction set.

columns.name: PTMT_TOTAL
columns.description: Total payment amount for the transaction.

columns.name: ATTACH_PP_BAT
columns.description: The unique ID of payment posting batch to which the transaction is attached.

columns.name: CNCLD_PB_ACT_TX_ID
columns.description: This column is populated if the transaction was reversed. The unique ID listed is that of the transaction that included the reversal.

columns.name: AP_CHECK_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the AP check issued from this premium billing account based on this premium billing transaction.

columns.name: REV_PB_PMT_ID
columns.description: If this transaction is a payment reversal, then this field lists the unique ID of the premium billing payment being reversed.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: The extract date and time of the record for this table.

columns.name: PMNT_REV_BY_PAX_ID
columns.description: The unique reversed by payment ID for the transaction. This refers to the PB account transactions being reversed as original PB account transactions.

columns.name: BAL_FWD_MIRROR_PB_ACT_TX_ID
columns.description: Keeps track of the link between the charge and credit premium billing amount by each storing the unique ID of the other amount.
